notes: Site known as Poets' Corner. Allocated site for a residential led, mixed use urban quarter. The project involves demolishing all of the existing buildings and delivering about 850 new homes across a range of tenures (including at least 200 build-to-rent units to be retained by the council), a new school, commercial and community space, and high quality public realm and landscaping.
ownership-status: owned by a public authority

notes: Pre-App received 26/7/17 (P/3579/17/PREAPP). Allocated site suitable for residential use

notes: Allocated site which is designated for mixed use in the Harrow and Wealdstone Area Action Plan. The council has already completed a comprehensive feasibility study which considered a range of options around high quality, commercial and residential development; including homes, offices, retail, hotel and leisure. The council is currently committed to retaining a significant proportion of parking provision on site.
ownership-status: owned by a public authority

notes: Allocated site. The redevelopment of Roxeth Library presents an exciting opportunity to create a transformative and inclusive facility for the local community, alongside new housing for the people of Harrow. It presents a chance to establish a distinctive sense of place for the library on the high street with a generous and high quality public setting that encourages social interaction and boosts the perception of the local high street and South Harrow Town Centre.
ownership-status: owned by a public authority

notes: Application received. Building a Better Harrow Regeneration site: The South Harrow estate was built in 1968 and is one of the last remaining examples of a construction type that uses fibreglass panels for external walls. The regeneration project will see 225 failing flats together with 47 other flats and bungalows replaced with around 545 mixed tenure homes.
ownership-status: owned by a public authority
